meta.description: Escape Lounge at Minneapolis-Saint Paul International Airport (MSP), Terminal 1, Concourse E. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Escape Lounge

location.terminalDirections: North end of the Airport Mall, at the entrance to Concourse E, take the stairs or elevator on the left to the Mezzanine Level.

lounge.description: At the Escape Lounge at Minneapolis – Saint Paul International Airport, our friendly staff are waiting to welcome you into a tranquil space where you can relax in a cozy corner or work in a quiet area away from the busy terminal. We’ll take care of your every need, while you sit back and enjoy our menu packed with delicious food and drinks. Whether you’re travelling alone or with family, you’re guaranteed a memorable start to your journey.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: Restrooms are located outside the lounge.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible for Terminal 1 flights only.
Access is available up to 3 hours prior to your flight departure.

reviews.content: Purchased a pass on Groupon, very good deal for two people. The lounge is comfortable, the food and drink was good. Restrooms are outside the lounge, only downside. Thumbs up to the staff.
Fantastic lounge with a very friendly staff.
Great food. Lots of open seating on a Tuesday at 3.
Delta lounge closed due to power outage. This lounge is rubbish. You are better off spending your money at one of the chains in the concourse.
Very nice, near Centurion quality level for folks with Platinum Amex. Lots of space to relax in a low-stress environment before a long flight. Very impressed with the food & beverage offerings.
Quieter than the other lounges around and during peak hours at the airport. Lots of room to sit, quiet to let you get some work done, or actually have a conversation. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Great ambiance. Similar to AMEX Centurion lounge in design elements. Yummy chocolate truffles!!!
Quiet at 0530 decent breakfast, lots of space to sit.
Very nice new lounge.  Great breakfast with scrambled egg bar. Lots of seating with plugs, although I was there quite early it was nearly empty.
Almost empty. Good food and nice feel.
Relatively empty at 5:15am. Great food, very clean. Lots of space to spread out.
Great food and kind and attentive staff — what more could you ask for?
Really nice big lounge with plenty of seating opinions for all guests. Food is really good and has a wide variety to choose from.
Arrived 20 minutes before closing to grab a quick snack and drink after traveling all day. Arrived at the lounge and no one was at the front desk and all the food was already put away.
This is a nice retreat away from the busy main concourse. Great food and service with normally not a lot of people. Would be a bonus to have restrooms inside the lounge.
Great lounge on par with Centurion Lounges. Good food selection, full bar, and best of all, it’s not very busy.  Free entry with AMEX Platinum. MUCH better than Delta’s lounges.
Much better than the Delta lounges. Nice and cozy and great selection of food to make a meal.
Unexpectedly good food spread. Super quiet even on a busy day in terminal. Accepts AMEX on Apple Pay if you don't have physical card.
Great place to relax and recharge your batteries.  Great food and friendly staff.
Decent lounge. At first the food selection looks small but it’s actually OK.
Food was great, even for breakfast. Incredible views of the runway, perfect if you’re an AV geek. While the restroom situation is a bit confusing, the whole experience was great. Also, not crowded!
If you have free access it’s worth the visit. Staff is nice but hardly anyone worked here — same person doing bar as front desk. The view was great. The food was solid and the atmosphere was quiet.
Great lounge with lots of room, ample food choices and friendly staff. Only knock is the bathroom situation where you have to leave the lounge.  Highly recommend.
Great lounge. Good food and service. Not very crowded.
No premium food, but plenty of buffet snack items to make a meal.
Great quiet place. The breakfast was actually pretty decent, and there are no less than 1000 places to charge your electronics.
Been here many times before, all of a sudden won’t accept a non confirmed ticket with Amex Platinum to get in. “New policy”
Beautiful, great food selection and seating options. Quiet too.
Great lounge for Amex Platinum card holders (Need to present card). Full bar with nice beer selection, salad bar, soup, hot dishes and small cheese /charcuterie selection. View of Gates E & F.
Nice quiet lounge. If you have Amex Platinum it feels like a private club compared to Sky Club.
Had to be at the airport before 6 am. Nice to know Escape lounge was opened at 4 am. Good breakfast items (juice, cheese, pastry, etc.), clean and quiet.
Great lounge. Allows guests with AmEx Platinum card. Plenty of space. Good food.
Very nice lounge. Nice food selection, comfortable seating, great views. Virtually empty while Delta lounge was packed...
Nice lounge. I wouldn’t pay to get in, but if you can access it free via Amex then it’s a pretty decent place to spend some time. Food’s only OK, but it’s quiet, clean and comfortable. Great views.
Better than the United and Delta lounges.
Amazing buffet of breakfast and lunch choices of fresh, quality, healthy, and tasty food.
Nice lounge with ample seating. We took our 1 year old and we had a nice little secluded area where he could stretch before the flight. Definitely recommended!
Nice lounge. I actually prefer this over the Delta one. Not very busy, good selection of stuff.
Great lounge. Nice selection of food and drinks, good decor and lighting and lots of space.
First time we used LoungeBuddy and spent 10 hours here! Can't imagine what we would have done without the Escape Lounge! Good good, drink and service.  Private comfortable seating.
Large lounge overlooking the ramp area. Buffet food including sandwiches and tacos. Also salads and cheeses and meats. Better than most domestic airline lounges. Friendly staff, comp drinks and food!
Standby passengers don’t have access. Losing out on a ton of travelers and those who often travel most frequently. Poor service offering.
Friendly staff, good food choices, plenty of quiet seating.
Very good option, loved the food and drink selection. Only downside is no bathroom inside lounge, otherwise great lounge.
Tried all the lounges, this is best. Really nice food, good bar selection, friendly service and good space.
Quiet, spacious lounge with large, comfy chairs and a nice selection of food and drinks. Pretty impressive considering it's a domestic lounge.
Decent breakfast, great lunch, large space.
Really nice lounge. I may have just lucked out since it's a Sunday afternoon but really quite and solid offering.
Comical amount of food.... do yourself a favor, if you have a Amex Platinum, go to the Escape Lounge.
Lots of seating options and outlets, fast wi fi, variety of good food options. Great cookies.  Nice view of the tarmac.  No bathrooms so you have to exit and come back in for that.
Nice lounge. Best thing about is it's quiet. If more people start coming, may go downhill. No bathrooms.
Best lounge at MSP in every way except the restrooms. Now I only visit the overcrowded DL lounges at MSP during delays for access to in person assistance.
Nice lounge for Amex Platinum folks. Legit food, you could have a light meal and be fine. Not crowded but still had to wait 5 mins for bartenders. Staff get bored and wander off.
Good selection was better than expected. Plenty of room.
Nice lounge! Quite and peaceful at a recent 10am visit on a Thursday. Nice spread of light bites in the food category and a well stocked bar. The bathrooms are outside the lounge.
Great domestic lounge with well above average food and snacks. Reminds me of the AMEX Centurion lounges. Bathrooms are located weirdly outside the lounge.
11 June 17 - was very unkept and understaffed. Food was about 1/4 stocked and poorly presented. Staff was very friendly but obviously stressed. Add more help and it would be an awesome lounge.
This lounge is ending Priority Pass access soon. They were short staffed when I arrived with little food out. When they do have food it's really good. Nicest lounge in MSP.
They are understaffed.  If they added more staff to keep it clean & serve food, I would rate it higher.
Certainly not fresh anymore. Barely any food out and dirty dishes/trash on many empty tables. Lounge was nicely laid out quiet. Bathrooms are not attached to lounge.
Understaffed, but good food and seating.

This lounge has decent food; however, the service is terrible - one person to check in/clean/bar tend/put out food. The result is empty food selections, long waits for drinks and check in. Could be better.
They now allow access with guest (free) for American Express Platinum Card members (show boarding pass and photo ID).
Food was okay, kinda bland. Lounge is very large and quiet! Decor is stylish, but having to leave the lounge for the bathrooms is annoying.

Decent. As others noted, the decor is similar to Centurion Lounges. Ample seating space but limited food selection. Nice gesture that there is no time restrictions. Would suggest installing bathrooms.
Very good food selection. Furniture is very clean.
Staff was very attentive. Some dirty dishes around, but very busy time (evening). For US lounge, superb food options.
I had a bad service experience on my visit but it was corrected.
It was a bummer that the bar does not open until 0600.
Clean, spacious, stylish, and nice view of the tarmac.
Friendly staff, decent machine coffee and edible eats. Worth stopping by esp if you're not flying DL. They just updated their food offerings including veg options.
Went there around 11:30, nothing much to eat. There was no description of what they were. Not veg friendly. It's clean and spacious though.
Quiet, comfortable lounge. Decent food, I enjoyed my stay!
There are comfy love seats to catch a nap.  Food is fairly solid. Good pours at the bar. Modern and convenient with lots of power...USB and otherwise.
Worth stopping by if you have Priority Pass.
Great lounge, food selections are above par with sandwiches, salads,  meats/cheeses, sweets, and chips. Good selection of items you can take on the go to. Spacious as well.
Generally nice and clean. Some of the food was picked over & dried out when I arrived. The place was quiet even with a few families with kids. Would consider returning, but not at full price.
Food is good, but supply is limited. They refill, but it can be overwhelmed in a rush. Nice views and relaxing.

As a Sky Club and Priority Pass member, it's my new MSP go to lounge. Good food offerings, Fiji water and a really good free Cab Sav./Fiji water. Staff was friendly and lounge was clean and not crowded.
Super polite staff, quiet and so much better than the way over crowded Delta lounge in terminal 1. Tons of charging options, bottled water, great food selection. Highly recommend!
Good, clean with decent food options. Much better than most domestic lounges. Had multiple salads, sandwiches, premium cheeses. Expresso machine. Modern decor with comfortable seating.
How did I not know this lounge was here? More like an international lounge. Quiet, good food and service. Access with Priority Pass.
I recently discovered this lounge and I love it. There is no AA club at MSP, and this lounge is very convenient to the AA gates. It has a good selection of free food and drinks and a friendly staff.
Very nice and spacious. The staff is very nice and helpful way better than the United Club!
Great food and amenities that rival the Centurion lounge. A great lounge in its own right, but even better since it's the sole Priority Pass lounge at MSP.
Great escape! Definitely worth it. Very quiet and comfortable. Lots of options for food and drink. Really friendly staff. Thumbs up!
Awesome lounge! One of the best domestic lounges around. Loved the mini sliders and Fiji water. Tons of seating and very quiet throughout. Great addition to MSP!
Great lounge, good food options, not crowded.
Great service. Comfortable location, and incredibly quiet on a Saturday. Great if you want to get out of the "mall" full of crying kids. Food was okay. A little too sharp for my taste.
Food was great. Service was very pleasant. View of the E GATES is magnificent.
Great lounge from UK based company. 1st one in US. Plan to open more in Oakland and Hartford.
Excellent new lounge: comfy, quiet, stylish, great view, with personal table service. The purchasable meals are well worth the nominal cost.

Spacious! Lots of seating, nicely designed. Great amenities-magazines/newspapers, bar, power outlets near most seating, booth seats. Happy that Priority Pass is accepted here now. Will be visiting a lot!
Love how they list out complimentary v. a la carte food and drink. Quiet. Modern. Clean. Great food selection!
Very cool space that has all the vibes of a Centurion Lounge. Now a Priority Pass lounge!

Great lounge, quiet with decent views. Staff were so helpful and snacks and drinks were good too. The space was quiet and relaxed but with many different seating areas, will come again - needs LB access.
Excellent staff. Quiet and undiscovered. Good mix of seating options and a nice view. Hope they join the Priority Pass network soon so l can skip the Delta lounge permanently.

location.terminalDirections: Located on the Mezzanine Level near Gate A1

otherLounges.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

location.terminalDirections: Located at the north end of the Airport Mall towards French Meadow Bakery and Starbucks. Take the stairs to the right of French Meadow to the Mezzanine Level. Check-in at the Golf Shop counter.

otherLounges.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

location.terminalDirections: Located at the entrance of Concourse F.

otherLounges.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club
